data.title: HEADUPS: Information about the big code reformat and what it means for your PRs
data.body:
Just a heads-up. As mentioned previously we're going to apply the new `clang-format` code formatting (#7547) to the whole code base, which means that virtually every line will get some whitespace changes, effectively breaking all pending PRs.

Don't freak out though, it's possible to fix PRs (or local code you may have) with some clever "manual" rebasing, e.g. as described here: https://engineering.mongodb.com/post/succeeding-with-clangformat-part-3-persisting-the-change/

I will post some instructions on how to do it when I've tested it locally. My plan is to start apply the reformat to my local *master* branch, and then try this manual rebase and document it for the *lambda* branch.

If you have unmerged work in your local *master* branch, I would advise that you branch it off to a backup branch, so that when I push the reformatted code you can just reset your master branch to the remote without losing work.

data.title: KinematicBody2D.move() doesn't work as intended
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
~~Present from at least 2.1, surely in 3.0 as well~~
~~Only relevant for 2.1 3.0 has its own issue.~~
More relevant for 2.1. Affectation for 3.0 is to be more deeply analyzed.

**Issue description:**
The typical use case for kinematic bodies is to call move() and if a collision is detected, call move() again with the slide vector.

The problem is that subsequent calls to move() during the same fixed frame don't take into account the accumulated position. In other words, the movement for any call to move() is considered to depart from wherever the body was at the fixed step.

I think such a big thing is barely noticeable because of the usual gravity keeping the body on the ground and some subtleties of the implementation.

Anyway, if I'm right that's a big bug that makes things not work as smoothly as they should. Furthermore, problems arise when one tries to make multiple motion attempts for more complex behavior (that's how I realized something wasn't working properly).

Maybe the 3D counterpart is also affected. Please someone confirm.

**The issue on 3.0:**

UPDATE: The 3.0 version has this somehow alleviated due to the "from" parameter for motion tests. But the implementation is still getting the AABBs of the shapes with the transform thas was applied at the beginning of the fixed step.

Since the shapes' AABB cache is not updated until the `NOTIFICATION_TRANSFORM_CHANGED` received per frame, they are out-dated on a subsequent call to the motion methods.

(See https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/f13e87e25799aafa4462779650c7d6222c782b31/servers/physics_2d/space_2d_sw.cpp#L613)

Untransforming the shapes AABBs with the current known transform and then applying the "from" transform to them at that point in code should do the trick.

What do you think? A better way?

**Solution:**

~~I have a PR almost ready and it seems to work well both for my game and for the kinematic character example but I want to hear opinions as soon as possible.~~

~~For 2.1 probably the wrong behavior should be left as the default to avoid breaking things so the fix comes as an optional thing.~~

EDIT: PR already submitted for 2.1.

**Steps to reproduce:**
(to be done)

data.title: Fix VisibilityNotifier2D viewport offset issue
data.body:
It seems when the root viewport is not at (0, 0) VisibilityNotifier2D seems to be offset as much as the viewport in relation to the window.

This should be tested with other stretch mode/aspect settings. If any knowledgeable member can give his impressions about this, it'd be helpful.

This would partially solve #4803.

data.body:

I see a few hurdles at the moment:

for each package:

data.title: Particles animate per frame per camera
data.body:
In Godot 2.1.2, with multiple cameras rendering at once, particles move at set speed * number of cameras. Probably related to #6578 (each viewport causes the whole rendering routine to be called each frame).

Possible solutions:
 • Set particle speed for all emitters to original speed / number of cameras (can be done in GDscript)
 • Make the renderer handle multiple cameras better

Anecdotal stuff:
 • I'm working on a VR game which is probably going to come out before Godot 3.0 hits beta. I know related features are on the eventual to-do list. I noticed this bug because I had a button to toggle between single-viewport and splitscreen. Demonstration attached.
 • I didn't see a 3D particle emitter in Godot 3.0 (at least with a build from a couple weeks ago), implying particles are under overhaul (explosiveness pl0x), possibly related to a renderer overhaul. Particles in Godot are tightly integrated with the renderer.

[particlizer.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/818356/particlizer.zip) (5.5 kB)

data.title: Fix handling input for Android (2.1)
data.body:
Fix #7735
For typing "하나" with korean keyboard, sequence is like this.
<kbd>ㅎ</kbd> > <kbd>ㅏ</kbd> > <kbd>ㄴ</kbd> > <kbd>ㅏ</kbd>
And this should be show as follow steps.

- "ㅎ" (1 character added)
- "하" (not added, but 1 character changed)
- "한" (not added, but 1 character changed)
- "하나" (added new one, and also 1 character changed at the same time)

This can't be handled by comparing text length.
We can cover this with `beforeTextChanged` and `onTextChanged`

 typing | 2.1.2-official | with this PR
--------|----------------|-------------
ㅎ | ㅎ   | ㅎ
ㅏ | ㅎ   | 하
ㄴ | ㅎ   | 한
ㅏ | ㅎ나   | 하나

This PR also fixes typing unavailable on Android 7.1.1 - Nexus 6p also.
And I guess it will fix if another languages have similar behavior.

Tested with English & Korean input and also delete key & suggested word on Android 4.1.2 (Galaxy s3) & 7.1.1 (Nexus 6p).

data.title: Reworked change_dir to support symlinks
data.body:
I have rewritten change_dir to support symlinks.
This works by allowing current_dir to diverge from what getcwd deems is the current directory as getcwd resolves symlinks to the actual real directory which we do not want to do.

This is a potential fix for #6539, #6047 and #5700

data.title: TabContainer's signal changes (v2.1)
data.body:
- Added `tab_selected` signal which has same behavior as `tab_changed`
lest breaking current API, though, it is noted in the documentation of TabContainer
class, of the upcoming Godot (v3.0+) changes in behavior, that is, `tab_selected` will be
emitted for selecting any tab, while `tab_changed` only if a tab changes.
- Added `get_previous_tab()`. Which returns the previous shown tab. **Note:** In Godot v3.0+, only `tab_changed` can modify previous tab index.
- Add documentation for the added function and signals. Fix a typo too.

data.title: Children stops to process when parent pause mode is PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS and tree is paused. Little fix
data.body:
I was to create screens with godot when I tried to stop one node and keeping the other running.
get_tree().set_pause(false)
nodeA.set_pause_mode(PAUSE_MODE_STOP)
nodeB.set_pause_mode(PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS)
get_tree().set_pause(true)

NodeA and B are children from main scene. I discover that problem is when run nodeB.set_pause_mode(PROCESS) the children from nodeB are stopped like if the nodeB was stopped too, but no, nodeB is the ONLY running, while their children are paused! I tried to alert this but it seems nobody understand.

Now the solution:
Go to the scene/main/ in godot's source
Open the file node.cpp
Go to line 72 and where has the else with data.pause_owner=NULL;, just change to data.pause_owner=this;
The problem was the data.pause_owner stay lost in some part of the code, that above in my opinion.
It was because that the program NEVER GOES BEYOND of the "if (!data.pause_owner)" in the function "Node::can_process()" when pause mode of the node is PAUSE_MODE_INHERIT

NOTE: I don't know how to add the fix to godot code, so please, anyone do this for me.]

Espero ser mais ouvido na próxima vez.
Passar bem.

data.title: Resizable editor / project settings dialogs & save their bounds
data.body:
Implements https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7921
Obsoletes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/7543

- Editor Settings, Export and Project Settings are now resizable.
- Size and position are stored in the editor settings under Interface/Dialogs. If someone can tell me how to hide this category in the Editor Settings window, I'd be thankful as it doesn't make much sense to display it in there plus it is the only subcategory to a category which has settings itself.
- Added an optional `Rect2` parameter to `Popup::popup()` to specify the area in which it should pop up.
- Overrode `Popup::_fix_size()` in `WindowDialog` to ensure the window chrome is visible aswell when pushing a popup window back into the view (pretty useless otherwise as the complete window chrome could still be out of bounds). Resizable windows also get shrunk if the available space is insufficient.

**Discussion:** Please suggest additional windows which should become resizable and their bounds remembered. My ideas so far:

- All open / save file popups (if called from one place) - can't do it right away because some places use the default FileDialog rather than the Editor file dialog.
